title: CTRL0000916055 - Transcribed Interview of Garrett M. Ziegler, (July 19, 2022)

data.text: JANUARY 6TH ATTACK ON THE U.S. CAPITOL,
The deposition in the above matter was held in Room 5480, O'Neill House Office
For the SELECT COMMITTEE TO INVESTIGATE
THE JANUARY 6TH ATTACK ON THE U.S. CAPITOL:
This is the deposition of Garrett Ziegler conducted by the House Select Committee
to Investigate the January 6th Attack on the United States Capitol pursuant to House
This will be a staff-led deposition, though members may choose to ask questions
I am a senior investigative counsel with the select
Members may join the deposition either in person or by Webex, and I'll do my best to
note their presence as they join.
Present in the room with me is
We'll be holding this deposition under House rules that we've previously provided
to Mr. Ziegler and his counsel.
Under those rules, Mr. Ziegler, you're permitted to have your attorney present.
I'll note for the record that your attorney is present and I'll have him identify himself in a
Counsel for other persons or other government agencies may not attend.
other words, the only lawyers who are present today are those from the select
At this time, I'd ask Mr. Ziegler's counsel to please state his name for the record.
My name is John Kiyonaga, K-i-y-o-n-a-g-a.
Garrett Ziegler, Z-i-e-g-1-e-r, the deponent in this matter.
Before we get started, I'd like to cover a few grounds rules for today's deposition.
As you heard me mention before -- well, maybe you didn't hear me mention
because I didn't say it -- we have an official reporter who's transcribing the deposition.
The deposition's also being video recorded, but the reporter's transcription is the official
it's completed before you give your answer, and I'll do my best to wait until you complete
your answer before I ask the next question.
So it's important that you wait to answer each question until
The reporter cannot note nonverbal responses, such as shaking or nodding of the
head, so it's important that you respond to each question with an audible verbal
If you need to take any breaks or would like to discuss anything with your attorney
privately, we're happy to accommodate you and take breaks as best we can.
You may only refuse to answer a question to preserve a privilege recognized by
either proceed with the deposition or seek a ruling from the chair on the objection at that
at the end of the deposition, you will be required to answer the question.
If you refuse to answer a question based on privilege, staff may
If the chairman overrules such an objection, either after the objection is made or
I want to remind you that it's unlawful to deliberately provide false information to
And because you will be taking an oath to tell the truth in this deposition, a
knowingly false answer could subject you to prosecution for perjury.
Do you have any questions on anything I said thus far?
Madam Reporter, I'd ask you to swear the witness, please.
Do you solemnly swear and affirm, under the penalty of perjury, that the
testimony you will give will be the truth, the whole truth, and nothing but the truth?
John, is there something you wanted to say on the record before we
Mr. Ziegler has complied fully with the subpoena for
That should not be taken as any concession on his part of the authority
of the committee to seek such.
and the fact that he is the person subject to the subpoena and has provided documents
and plenary compliance therewith, he is going to be refusing to answer any further
questions based on his Fifth Amendment privilege against self-incrimination,
acknowledging the fact that incrimination does not connote any consciousness of guilt.
Rather, it is any disclosure or statement that could tend to excite or encourage a
He is going to be, beyond acknowledging his identity
surmise of guilt on the part of a third party, specifically any law enforcement entity, which
definition I would take for purposes of this hearing to include the committee, and which
concern is manifestly well-founded given the fact that his previous boss has been arrested
But also comprised within his invocation of privilege will be an executive privilege,
deliberative privilege, Presidential communication privilege, privilege founded on
freedom of association and First Amendment and privacy as the case may be.
But I've instructed him in response to specific questions beyond the initial
questions acknowledging who he is and why he's here simply to invoke his privilege.
And I'm explaining ahead of time what that means to avoid a word salad every time a
If there develops a disagreement between myself or himself and the committee as
to whether or not he is entitled to invoke privilege, he is going to require a ruling from an
Article Ill judge, a United States district judge, compelling responses.
bound by a determination by the committee.
So I'm not going to respond to sort of all that.
I do want to point out that we are not a -- this committee is not a law
on that issue to connote any sort of type of agreement with your -- with the assumption
that you've made in connection with that statement.
So I want to state that for the record and don't want my silence
Yeah, I understand, and I note your disagreement.
So the fact that it's part of the legislative branch doesn't change the practical effect, in
But my position, his position, is that the committee is acting as one.
And in terms of invoking privileges -- well, I take it that Mr.
Ziegler is going to, on your advice, is going to invoke the Fifth Amendment to any
And I'd be fine -- I think it would be helpful to articulate that clearly.
If there are other objections that you also have that you'd like to reserve, I think that's
also fine as well and not have to sort of state those every time.
But I do want it to be clear, if there's a particular question to which Mr. Ziegler is
asserting his Fifth Amendment rights, then that should be stated for the record.
Well, what I'd like to do is assert his rights in the plural,
understanding ahead of time that those comprise principally his Fifth Amendment right,
but also on an individual basis the other rights that I've mentioned.
to be bound by an analysis that I make on the fly in here today as to exactly which other
But I would state at the outset that the Fifth Amendment privilege should be
taken, as far as we're concerned, to apply to any question you ask beyond the initial
So in other words, the other privileges that I mentioned a moment ago may or
may not apply to particular questions that you ask, but the Fifth Amendment privilege will
that you're going to be asking beyond the initial confirmation of who he is.
So that that will -- that should cover basically any substantive question
Anything else we need to cover before we get started?
Mr. Ziegler, if you can take a look at exhibit 1 in your binder.
Exhibit 1 is the subpoena from this committee dated April 27th, 2022.
Do you understand that you're appearing here today pursuant to that subpoena?
The subpoena also calls for production of documents and information,
Have you conducted a diligent search for records that are responsive to the
Have you produced to the committee all documents and communications in
your possession, custody, or control that are responsive to the requests described in the
Speak up when you say yes.
Don't mutter it into your chest.
Could you describe, generally, what efforts you took to comply with this
I conducted a search based on all of the electronic devices that I have access
to and own and went through them diligently, including the electronic accounts, to mean
email accounts, most of which I do not have access to anymore, particularly my former
White House account where the lion's share of this correspondence would reside.
And I understand that, based on my cursory knowledge of the Presidential
Records Act, that account and all the materials therein are in the National Archives.
When you say the account information, do you mean that you went online,
for example, to Gmail or some other ISP, and tried to access your records that way as
Could you indulge me one minute.
Did you look for hard copy documents, including any notebooks or notes of
In your search for electronically stored information, did you also look for
documents in addition to electronic communications?
documents or Excel spreadsheets or things of that nature?
And in terms of emails that you searched, did you -- I think you mentioned
your work email and maybe difficulty -- your prior work email -- difficulty getting access
Did you look for documents, responsive documents connected to all of the email
addresses that you had in the relevant time period?
With respect to messages, did you search for text messages?
Did you just have one phone during the relevant timeframe?
Did you look for responsive messages under various messaging applications,
And then, obviously, I don't have the work phone anymore.
for example, Signal or Telegram or WhatsApp?
How about social media private messages?
did you use those platforms to communicate with other individuals?
And did you search those platforms to see if you had responsive documents?
Have you destroyed, deleted, or otherwise manipulated any documents
responsive to the requests described in the subpoena?
Have you withheld from production any responsive documents based on a
So there's no document that you found that appeared responsive, but you
felt that because of any other privileges that your counsel has referenced or otherwise
that you feel you needed to or could produce the document?
Could you briefly describe your educational background, starting
I attended Saint Louis University in St. Louis, Missouri.
What jobs have you held since graduating from college?
Just at the White House from February of 2019 to January of 2021, and then
What was your title in the White House beginning in February 2019?
Within a particular office within the White House?
Yes, the Office of Trade and Manufacturing Policy.
How did you get that position?
So your job at the White House was your first job upon graduation from
I'm going to ask you to invoke.
I'm invoking my right under the Fifth Amendment to not answer
So you're invoking your Fifth Amendment right not to answer that question?
How long did you work in the Office of Trade and Manufacturing Policy?
I invoke my right to silence.
To whom did you report during the 23 months that you worked at the Office
Something else you wanted to say in response to
I invoke my right to silence.
In late 2020, approximately how many people worked in the Office of Trade
I invoke my right to silence.
While you were working in the White House, did you do any work for the
I invoke my right to silence.
Was that the direction of Peter Navarro?
I invoke my right to silence under the Fifth Amendment.
Mr. Navarro had said publicly that he allowed several members of his staff to
help out in battleground States on their own time.
I invoke my right to silence under the Fifth Amendment.
What campaign activities, if any, were you involved with in 2020?
I invoke my right to silence under the Fifth Amendment.
Are you going to assert your Fifth Amendment privilege against
self-incrimination to any questions I would ask you about your work on the 2020
After the 2020 election, did you assist with any efforts by the Trump
campaign to challenge the results of the election?
I invoke my right to silence under the Fifth Amendment.
Did Mr. Navarro direct you to assist the Trump campaign in its efforts to
I invoke my right to silence under the Fifth Amendment.

I invoke my right to silence under the Fifth Amendment.

I invoke my right to silence under the Fifth Amendment.

Policy participate in efforts to challenge or overturn the 2020 election?
I invoke my right to silence under the Fifth Amendment.

assisted in efforts to challenge the 2020 election?
I invoke my right to silence under the Fifth Amendment.

I invoke my right to silence under the Fifth Amendment.

I invoke my right to silence under the Fifth Amendment.
Alexander Szarka, did he participate in those efforts?
I invoke my right to silence under the Fifth Amendment.

I invoke my right to silence under the Fifth Amendment.

I invoke my right to silence under the Fifth Amendment.

who were not tasked with work relating to overturning the 2020 election during the time
I invoke my right to silence under the Fifth Amendment.

many hours per day did you spend working on issues related to contesting the 2020
I invoke my right to silence under the Fifth Amendment.
Are you able to estimate what percentage of Mr. Navarro's time he spent
working on election-related matters in November and December of 2020?
I invoke my right to silence under the Fifth Amendment.
Mr. Ziegler, are you going to assert your Fifth Amendment privilege against
self-incrimination to any questions I would ask of you regarding your efforts to assist in
challenging or overturning the results of the 2020 election?
And would you likewise assert your Fifth Amendment privilege against
self-incrimination to any questions I would ask you about Mr. Navarro's efforts in that
Did you work with someone -- Strike that.
Do you know someone named Christos Makridis?
I invoke my right under the Fifth Amendment to silence.
Did Mr. Makridis assist in the efforts to challenge or overturn the 2020
I invoke my right to silence under the Fifth Amendment.
Do you know someone named Riley?
I invoke my right to silence under the Fifth Amendment.

I invoke my right to silence under the Fifth Amendment.

I invoke my right to silence under the Fifth Amendment.

I invoke my right to silence under the Fifth Amendment.

I invoke my right to silence under the Fifth Amendment.

Trump campaign regarding strategies for overturning the results of the 2020 election?
I invoke my right to silence under the Fifth Amendment.

I invoke my right to silence under the Fifth Amendment.

I invoke my right to silence under the Fifth Amendment.

I invoke my right to silence under the Fifth Amendment.

Have you ever been to the Trump Hotel?

I invoke my right to silence under the Fifth Amendment.
I invoke my right to silence under the Fifth Amendment.

I invoke my right to silence under the Fifth Amendment.

I invoke my right to silence under the Fifth Amendment.

I invoke my right to silence under the Fifth Amendment.

I'm invoking my right to silence under the Fifth Amendment.

Have you ever been to a ranch in South Carolina owned by Lin Wood?
I'm invoking my right to silence under the Fifth Amendment.
I'm invoking my right to silence under the Fifth Amendment.

I'm invoking my right to silence under the Fifth Amendment.

I'm invoking my right to silence under the Fifth Amendment.

Have you heard that term used with respect to the 2020 election?
I'm invoking my right to silence under the Fifth Amendment.

I'm invoking my right to silence under the Fifth Amendment.

Are you going to assert your Fifth Amendment privilege against

I'll represent to you this is the cover sheet of a
much longer document or set of documents that's commonly referred to as the Navarro
Did you play any role in the preparation of the Navarro Report?
I'm invoking my right to silence under the Fifth Amendment.

I'm invoking my right to silence under the Fifth Amendment.
You've said publicly that there's a time when you were spending 6 hours a
I'm invoking my right to silence under the Fifth Amendment.
What was the purpose of the Navarro Report?
I'm invoking my right to silence under the Fifth Amendment.
The introduction to volume 1 -- actually let's take a look at exhibit 3.
Have you seen this document before?
I'm invoking my right to silence under the Fifth Amendment.
I'll represent to you this is what I understand to be volume 1 of the Navarro
If you take a look at the introduction on page 5, the very end of the introduction,
it says, "If, in fact" -- the second to last paragraph -- "If, in fact, compelling evidence
comes to light proving the election was indeed stolen after a fait accompli Biden
inauguration, we as a country run the very real risk that the very center of our American
At the very end of the next paragraph it says, "It is, therefore, critical that we get
to the bottom of this matter.
That is the purpose of this report."
Do you agree with that description of the purpose of the Navarro report?
I'm invoking my right to silence under the Fifth Amendment.
Volume 1 of the report purports to describe election irregularities in six
Where did the information come from for this report?
I'm invoking my right to silence under the Fifth Amendment.
The report frequently refers to alleged irregularities, but at various times it
cites -- or purports to cite -- evidence supporting certain election fraud claims.
Was it the intent of the report to highlight the allegations that had been made or
to reach conclusions regarding the veracity or strength of the allegations that were made
I'm invoking my right to silence under the Fifth Amendment.
A portion of exhibit 3 refers to allegations of bribery that
occurred -- supposedly occurred -- in connection with the 2020 election in the State of
Did you personally investigate allegations of election-related bribery in Nevada?

I'm invoking my right to silence under the Fifth Amendment.

I'm invoking my right to silence under the Fifth Amendment.

I'm invoking my right to silence under the Fifth Amendment.

I'm invoking my right to silence under the Fifth Amendment.

I'm invoking my right to silence under the Fifth Amendment.

represent to you that's an email to Mark Meadows.

I'm invoking my right to silence under the Fifth Amendment.

I'm invoking my right to silence under the Fifth Amendment.

In the latest in time email in this chain, you send -- it appears that you send

Was that your email at the time?

If you look at the documents that are attached to or behind the email chain

Have you seen these documents before?

Have you seen this document before?

The document includes an attachment or a portion of the email -- it's not

Have you seen this document before?

In this email and its attachments, Mr. Raiklin talks about various powers that

I'm invoking my right to silence under the Fifth Amendment.
Take a look at exhibit 6, please.

The document is entitled, "Analyzing the Election:

I'm invoking my right to silence under the Fifth Amendment.

Willard Intercontinental, I think, might be the full name.

And your answer is you're refusing to answer that question on Fifth

Mr. Schiff, do you have any questions of the witness?
It took me long to hit the unmute button.
Hearing none, I think we're done.
We can go off the record for a second.
[Whereupon, at 10:58 a.m., the deposition was recessed subject to the call of the
We're going to be in recess subject to the call of the chair.
